notes: The Bosch P7100 mechanical injection pump ('P-Pump') from the 94-98 12-valve Cummins is the holy grail for reliability and power. It can be swapped onto the later 24-valve Cummins (VP44 pump) to eliminate the unreliable electronics. Requires new fuel lines, timing case, and injectors.

The Ford 7.3L Powerstroke IS an International T444E. However, the electronics, water pump, and accessory drive differ. The long block (heads, block, rotating assembly) is identical. T444E parts are often cheaper but check for specific sensor locations.

The Allison 1000 5/6-speed automatic found behind the Duramax is legendary for strength. It is a popular swap for Dodge Cummins trucks (replacing the weak 47RE/48RE) and older Fords. Requires an adapter plate, flexplate, and a standalone transmission controller.

The 'Kingpin' Dana 60 is the strongest front axle ever put in light trucks. Ford versions (driver's side drop) are sought after for Jeep swaps. Chevy/Dodge versions (passenger side drop) are for older builds. Kingpins are stronger and more durable than the later ball-joint Dana 60s.

The Holset HE351CW turbo from the 04.5-07 'Common Rail' Cummins flows much better than the HX35 found on older 12V/24V trucks. It's a cheap junkyard upgrade for 2nd Gen Rams. Requires modifying the intercooler pipe (clocking the housing) and a new downpipe flange.
